channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: TripoSG: High-Fidelity 3D Shape Synthesis using Large-Scale Rectified Flow Models
item.description: Specifically, we propose: 1) A large-scale rectified flow transformer for 3D shape generation, achieving state-of-the-art fidelity through training on extensive, high-quality data.

item.title: InfiniteYou: Flexible Photo Recrafting While Preserving Your Identity
item.description: Achieving flexible and high-fidelity identity-preserved image generation remains formidable, particularly with advanced Diffusion Transformers (DiTs) like FLUX.

item.title: Open Deep Search: Democratizing Search with Open-source Reasoning Agents
item.description: Open Search Tool is a novel web search tool that outperforms proprietary counterparts.

item.title: Reverse Multi-Choice Dialogue Commonsense Inference with Graph-of-Thought
item.description: With the proliferation of dialogic data across the Internet, the Dialogue Commonsense Multi-choice Question Answering (DC-MCQ) task has emerged as a response to the challenge of comprehending user queries and intentions.

item.title: VGGT: Visual Geometry Grounded Transformer
item.description: We present VGGT, a feed-forward neural network that directly infers all key 3D attributes of a scene, including camera parameters, point maps, depth maps, and 3D point tracks, from one, a few, or hundreds of its views.

item.title: CFG-Zero*: Improved Classifier-Free Guidance for Flow Matching Models
item.description: Classifier-Free Guidance (CFG) is a widely adopted technique in diffusion/flow models to improve image fidelity and controllability.

item.title: LHM: Large Animatable Human Reconstruction Model from a Single Image in Seconds
item.description: Animatable 3D human reconstruction from a single image is a challenging problem due to the ambiguity in decoupling geometry, appearance, and deformation.

item.title: Zep: A Temporal Knowledge Graph Architecture for Agent Memory
item.description: We introduce Zep, a novel memory layer service for AI agents that outperforms the current state-of-the-art system, MemGPT, in the Deep Memory Retrieval (DMR) benchmark.

item.title: Reinforcement Learning Enhanced LLMs: A Survey
item.description: This paper surveys research in the rapidly growing field of enhancing large language models (LLMs) with reinforcement learning (RL), a technique that enables LLMs to improve their performance by receiving feedback in the form of rewards based on the quality of their outputs, allowing them to generate more accurate, coherent, and contextually appropriate responses.

item.title: KBLaM: Knowledge Base augmented Language Model
item.description: In this paper, we propose Knowledge Base augmented Language Model (KBLaM), a new method for augmenting Large Language Models (LLMs) with external knowledge.

item.title: Large Language Model Agent: A Survey on Methodology, Applications and Challenges
item.description: The era of intelligent agents is upon us, driven by revolutionary advancements in large language models.

item.title: ImageNet Classification with Deep Convolutional Neural Networks
item.description: We trained a large, deep convolutional neural network to classify the 1. 3 million high-resolution images in the LSVRC-2010 ImageNet training set into the 1000 different classes.

item.title: Optimal Stepsize for Diffusion Sampling
item.description: Diffusion models achieve remarkable generation quality but suffer from computational intensive sampling due to suboptimal step discretization.

item.title: IndexTTS: An Industrial-Level Controllable and Efficient Zero-Shot Text-To-Speech System
item.description: Recently, large language model (LLM) based text-to-speech (TTS) systems have gradually become the mainstream in the industry due to their high naturalness and powerful zero-shot voice cloning capabilities. Here, we introduce the IndexTTS system, which is mainly based on the XTTS and Tortoise model.

item.title: Video-R1: Reinforcing Video Reasoning in MLLMs
item.description: However, directly applying RL training with the GRPO algorithm to video reasoning presents two primary challenges: (i) a lack of temporal modeling for video reasoning, and (ii) the scarcity of high-quality video-reasoning data.

item.title: CPPO: Accelerating the Training of Group Relative Policy Optimization-Based Reasoning Models
item.description: This paper introduces Completion Pruning Policy Optimization (CPPO) to accelerate the training of reasoning models based on Group Relative Policy Optimization (GRPO).

item.title: Fin-R1: A Large Language Model for Financial Reasoning through Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Reasoning large language models are rapidly evolving across various domains.

item.title: FEC: Fast Euclidean Clustering for Point Cloud Segmentation
item.description: Segmentation from point cloud data is essential in many applications such as remote sensing, mobile robots, or autonomous cars.

item.title: Rankify: A Comprehensive Python Toolkit for Retrieval, Re-Ranking, and Retrieval-Augmented Generation
item.description: Retrieval, re-ranking, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) are critical components of modern applications in information retrieval, question answering, or knowledge-based text generation.

item.title: MiniCheck: Efficient Fact-Checking of LLMs on Grounding Documents
item.description: We release LLM-AggreFact, code for data synthesis, and models.
